column2: Needs assessments of triggers to identify the need for an EA. (before EA launch)
column3: Disaster Brief done for the  Management Call to inform the FAD between 48-72
column4: EA is launched within 24 hours after the FAD has been approved (or within 48 hours after field report was published).
column5: Operational Strategy validated 10 to 14  days after the EA
column6: A resource mobilization plan is developed and approved within 3 to 4 weeks of the EA that looks at long term funding and sustianability.
column7: IFRC advocates with NS  for the approval and use of  Surge or  in country capacity from movement partners within the first  5 days of the trigger
column8: RR personnel Alert sent within 12h of the request
column9: Identification of 1st rotation RR personnel within 5 days of the alert *if not aligned to readiness process could be slower
column10: Key initial longer-term positions identified by operational leadership and requested via submission in the HR system, one week after the EA publication
column11: Once approved in the HR system and pre-classified JD provided, HR advertises key initial longer-term positions within 48 hours.
column12: Hold a mini summit within 48 h of the disaster
column13: Review/adapt membership coordination framework for the context for this specific emergency
column14: Ensure an appropriate membership coordination framework is in place after 24h of trigger
column15: Initial supply chain plan developed between logs and ops coordinator within 1 week of the approved EA
column16: Fully approved and submitted requisitions for NFIs within 1 week of the EA (when relevant)
column17: NFI (or emergencies items) being delivered to the country in 3 days since the Requistion
column18: NFIs distributed to targetted population within one month of the EA
column20: If the country is not MSR, enough resource (HR/Funds) have been allocated to operate in a Red/orange security phase areas
